overview:
Josh writes code. He typically writes lots of code with Visual Studio and the popular language he does this in is C#. He also likes SQL. It doesn’t matter much which flavour of SQL as it’s fairly standard and that’s what he loves about it. Perhaps it’s obvious, but Josh thinks MSSQL is pretty cool.

Josh likes to write code for business. He’s doing his best to model himself into a business optimization person. What’s that mean? That means he takes business process and makes it cheaper to run. It also means he creates a way to measure the improvement.

Josh is a signatory to the Agile Manifesto and loves working with Lean methodologies in regards to software.
